quest.name: Integrity
journal:
Fremondain's eyes are alight with hope.

In order to complete this quest, you must have learned the advanced recipes contained within Master Blacksmith III.

The final round of the grand tournament has come, and Fremondain informs you that Baroness Laurisse is off to a flying start. She has proven herself in the eyes of many spectators, and become a crowd favorite. However, now that she will face the final eight challengers, he fears his mistress needs every advantage. He bids you forge a high-quality adamantite winglet, of the same size and shape as the original Integrity. Do so, that the steward might present a truly fearsome weapon to the baroness.

In order to complete this quest, you must have learned the advanced recipes contained within Master Blacksmith III.

Fremondain gratefully accepts the adamantite winglet, and transfers the sacred bone to the new weapon. Baroness Laurisse joins you, and Fremondain makes to present her the sword. However, in so doing, he reveals that he has not paid you so much as one gil. Taken aback, the baroness refuses the gift─until a few heartfelt words from her loyal steward cause her to change her mind. Yet she will not simply have it for free, and gives you the last remaining valuable of House Jervaint, the cygnine rosary, with the understanding that you will return it in exchange for her winnings in the tournament. Suddenly nervous, Baroness Laurisse leaves to find either great glory or abject failure in the final round. Fremondain bids you follow her to the Lightfeather Proving Grounds, and encourage her if necessary.

You find the baroness standing outside of the proving grounds. She is nervous, though she does not admit it in quite so many words. However, your presence allows her to find some measure of confidence, and the splendor of Integrity gives her even more. Thanking you, she turns and goes through the gates, and to whatever fate awaits therein. Join Fremondain in the Jeweled Crozier, and wait for tidings of the daughter of House Jervaint.

Baroness Laurisse returns with sad news: she lost in the first bout to an opponent far greater in stature and girth. However, such was her ferocity and bravery that the Temple Knights took notice. Via a messenger, they offer Baroness Laurisse the position of apprentice squire, and praise her valor. The man also inquires into the origin of Integrity, and Baroness Laurisse proudly proclaims it the work of Master Forename. You return the cygnine rosary, and take your payment for all the work you have done...finally. The daughter of House Jervaint says that you are doubtless meant for greater things yet, and gives her thanks. You have raised a hero with your creations, and now, the hero will carry your name to new heights.

※The next blacksmith quest will be available from Brithael once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Forge an adamantite winglet Deliver the adamantite winglet to Fremondain in Ishgard.
Speak with Laurisse in front of the Lightfeather Proving Grounds.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname, the final round of the tourney has begun!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Milady has won six bouts with ease, and those who dismissed her skill as mere luck have eaten their words!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: The crowd is in awe of her strength and fury. Why, I have even heard it said that she is Saint Finnea come again!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: The comparison is well merited. Milady's sword arm is excellent, but she wins because she is relentless. Even brave contenders have forfeited from fear.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Now, however, she stands with eight others of equal might. I fear without Integrity... Please, my friend, forge anew a fine host for the sword─an adamantite winglet, I believe you said!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to complete this quest, you must have learned the advanced recipes contained within Master Blacksmith III.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Is it done, MistressMaster Surname? Has the new host for Integrity been forged?

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Halone above... Magnificent, simply magnificent! If you will allow me to transfer the remains of Saint Finnea...

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: There─a relic and reliquary reborn!

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Fremondain, of all the times to─ Ah, Forename. Weaponry?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Fury take me─you remade that rusty sword?

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Out of the kindness of herhis heart, milady! It is a masterpiece, is it not? And it is yours, free of charge!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: The blade is blessed! The hilt is a reliquary of Saint Finnea, and bound within are the prayers of your ancestors─no doubt uttered during pitched battles!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: When you wield this blade, all of House Jervaint walks with you. Allow me to present Integrity! May it carry you to victory this day!

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: ...Free of charge? All this...for nothing? I cannot accept this.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: I had thought it strange that we could afford a smith of Forename's caliber with my coffers so bare... How did you pay, Fremondain? With promises?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: How could you!? However low, I am still a noble! I will not taint my name by turning beggar because of ill fortune, nor...nor tarnish my victory with this sword!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: B-But, Baroness, only the blade has been remade─House Jervaint's prayers were yours, and are yours! A-And what of MistressMaster Surname? SheHe has poured herhis hopes into the weapon!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: As have I! We are the people you wish to protect, yes? How can you deny your duty to us? How can you just leave this sword to rust!?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: N-No, I could never. My father would...would...

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: You have the right of it. I will be proud to wield Integrity. But I will offer you recompense, Forename.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: The cygnine rosary, milady!? But that is the only valuable left. And it was your parents' favorite!

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: I know, Fremondain. When I am champion, Forename, I will give you the tourney prize to have it back. Is that all right?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Thank you. Well, now to the eight bouts before me. If the Temple Knights see me at my best, then I will join them. But...but if I lose even one...

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: You two, await...await me here. I will return from the proving grounds to tell you if I win─when I win...

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: I have never seen her so unsure... She needs our support. Your support. My fretting will only cause her greater worry.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Please, MistressMaster Surname, milady has need of you. With so much at stake, the Lightfeather Proving Grounds must seem intimidating...

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Forename, why are you─ Oh, who cares? Thank you for coming. I was just taking a deep breath. The air inside is vile.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Me? Worried? O-Of course not...I am Laurisse de Jervaint!

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Never give up, never give in, as Father said. Lead by example─no weakness, no faltering. I must be iron─unbending, unyielding. As...as Father said...

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: He was a good leader, Forename. I can be, too. A voice for the voiceless.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: ...I will win.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: I feel as if I am holding my father's hand.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text:
Courage, Laurisse, courage.
Thank you...my friend. I will return with good tidings.

dialogue.name: JUDGE02011
dialogue.text: Forward!

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: ...Watch over me, Father.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname!

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: I could not stand the waiting! Is milady...?

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Thank you. She needed encouragement. I am glad you were here to give it. Well...shall we wait for tidings?

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: The tourney ought to have ended by now. Where is─

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Milady! Dare I hope that...?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: ...But the sword was wonderful, truly. It was my strength that...

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: No...

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: Pardon me, Baroness. The Temple Knights have sent me to find you, as you left the arena before the awarding of honors.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Should I have stayed, ser? I lost in the first bout.

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: The champion's laurels were not yours, my lady, but you have won an honor─that of the most valiant.

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: You faced an opponent who was thrice your size, yet neither retreated nor hesitated. In truth, we thought you would pummel the man to death! None who saw the tourney will soon forget your fury, madam.

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: Ser Handeloup himself was impressed. He wishes to discuss your potential with the lord commander.

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: My...my─ With Ser Aymeric!?

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: Just so. Ser Handeloup has also asked that you be elevated to apprentice squire forthwith. It is a humble title, but one once held by many of the Temple Knights' finest.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Milady! Is this not everything you have dreamt of?

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: My lady, if I may─where did you find that glorious sword?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: Integrity? It is the sword of House Jervaint made anew by this master of the forge, Forename.

dialogue.name: ESQUIRE02011
dialogue.text: Master Forename─I will make it a point to remember the name. Well, Baroness Laurisse, I will bid you adieu. Ah, but allow me to present your winnings.

dialogue.name: FREMONDAIN
dialogue.text: Will...will it be payment enough for the cygnine rosary?

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: I called you a master, for a master you are, Forename. And I could have done none of this without your aid. We will...

dialogue.name: LAURISSE
dialogue.text: I need not continue. It is our exploits, our victories, that history will remember, not our words, and I have no doubt you will be mighty in deed. May you ever reach new heights, my friend.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the blacksmith quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next blacksmith quest will be available from Brithael.
